answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples of cities using cloud computing. 
This ICMA study, Using Free, Open-Source Software in Local Governments: Streamlined Internal Computing for Better Performance and Record Keeping, includes 6 case studies about cities using cloud computing.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301522
This presentation from the City of Mauldin, SC discusses the benefits of cloud computing.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302878
Williamsburg, VA uses cloud computing to help improve citizen engagement.
http://icma.org/en/Article/101049/Williamsburg_VA_Improves_Citizen_Engagement_through_Enhanced_Online_Video_of_Meetings
This article from American City and County lists a variety of ways that different cities use cloud computing.
http://americancityandcounty.com/technology/cloud-computing-201101/
Colorado has also been making the transition to cloud computing. This report from the Colorado Governor's Office of Information Technology discusses that process.
http://www.colorado.gov/cs/Satellite?blobcol=urldata&blobheadername1=Content-Disposition&blobheadername2=Content-Type&blobheadervalue1=inline%3B+filename%3D%22Moving+Colorado+to+the+Cloud%3A+A+Business+Case.pdf%22&blobheadervalue2=application%2Fpdf&blobkey=id&blobtable=MungoBlobs&blobwhere=1251656628209&ssbinary=true
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Tracy Miller
text:
The Alliance for Innovation is interested in knowing any members that are currently using cloud computing to host their technology.  Please respond here or directly to tmiller@transformgov.org with what you are using and how long you have been using it for.    
Best Regards,  
Tracy Miller  
Florida Regional Director
